Target
Target

TCP/IP SystemVerilog SHUNT Target (client) implementation.  Handles communication with Initiator and implements various data type loopback tests.

Functions
__init__
def __init__(
self
)

Initialize Target class with default values.

init_target
def init_target(
self,
portno,
hostname
)

Initialize the TCP/IP socket for the Target (client).

Parameter: portno

Port number for the TCP/IP socket

Parameter: hostname

Host name or IP address to connect to

Returns: Socket identifier for established connection

header_loopback_test
def header_loopback_test(
self,
socket_id
)

Perform loopback test for transaction header.  Receives a header from Initiator and sends it back.

Parameter: socket_id

Socket identifier for the connection

short_loopback_test
def short_loopback_test(
self,
socket_id
)

Perform loopback test for short data type.  Receives a short integer from Initiator, displays it, and sends it back.

Parameter: socket_id

Socket identifier for the connection

def header_data_loopback_test(
self,

)

Parameter: socket_id

Socket identifier for the connection

print_shunt_header
def print_shunt_header(
self,
h_,
name_in
 = 
"",
i_am
 = 
""
)

Print the contents of a SHUNT header.

Parameter: h_

Header structure to print

Parameter: name_in

Name identifier for the header

Parameter: i_am

Identifier for the caller
